Authors: Wang G., Putri N.M., Christianto A., Danny Hutama W.
Title: An empirical examination of characteristics of mobile payment users in Indonesia
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wang, G., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putri, N.M., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Christianto, A., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Danny Hutama, W., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The current use of mobile devices is a necessity for almost all people, especially in Indonesia. A total of more than 100 million mobile phones have been used by the Indonesian people and approximately 150 million cellular cards have been registered in Indonesia. This is an opportunity for entrepreneurs in the technology field to take advantage of this business opportunity to create applications that use mobile devices such as banking applications. In Indonesia, banking applications have existed since 2007 and continue to grow until now with almost the same features. After testing the questionnaire, it was found that innovativeness, reachability, compatibility, convinience affect perceived usefulness and perceived ease of use towards the intention of use. © 2005 – ongoing JATIT & LLS.
Author Keywords: Individual differences; Mobile payment; Mobile payment users; System characteristics
